title: Standardized scores for Iowa and Ohio corn weight

content.question: If an ear of corn from the farm in Ohio weighs <math alttext="1.39" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1.39</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> pounds, how many standard deviations from the mean is the weight with respect to the Ohio distribution?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.46" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.46</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations below the mean
<math alttext="1.46" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.46</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations above the mean
<math alttext="1.65" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations above the mean
<math alttext="1.88" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.88</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations below the mean
<math alttext="1.88" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.88</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations above the mean

content.answer: <math alttext="1.46" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.46</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviations above the mean

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
